parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I am awake (in the night), watch, (b) I am watchful, on the alert, vigilant. From egeiro; to keep awake, i.e. Watch.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From peirazo; a putting to proof (of good), experience (of evil), solicitation, discipline or provocation); by implication, adversity.
A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Eager, ready, willing, prompt. From pro and thumos; forward in spirit, i.e. Predisposed; neuter alacrity.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
(lit: not strong), (a) weak (physically, or morally), (b) infirm, sick. Strengthless.
